title: Drawing, "Profile of a woman and a floorplan", 1892
medium: Brush and watercolor, white gouache, pen and red ink, graphite on gray laid paper. Ruled border in graphite, mounted on off-white wove paper.
markings: Partial watermark: two letters in double ovoid.
signed:
Recto: Signed and dated in pen and red ink, lower left: MORAN./ 1892.
Mount: Signed in pen and black ink, lower center margin: T.Moran, 1892.
Verso: Signed in graphite: ...TMoran...
inscribed:
Recto: Inscribed in pen and blue ink, lower right: San Juan, Mexico.

Mount: Inscribed in pen and black ink, upper right margin: 20; again at upper center margin: watercolor on gray paper.; and in pen and blue ink, lower left margin:  The Hacienda of San Juan Mexico; and in pen and black ink at lower center margin: T. Moran, 1892.

Verso: Insribed in graphite: San Juan./On the Lerma River/ Mexico/TMoran/37 w 22.
description: Horizontal view with foreground filled by water or a river, wooded banks at right and left middle ground.  Peasants gathered at water trough at left. Two barges at right center. Buildings on top of hills in background.  Church with dome and tower included at right.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource
Two Artists of the American West: Albert Bierstadt and Thomas Moran
The Most Remarkable Scenery: Thomas Moran Watercolors of the American West
Drawings by Centurions, lent by the Cooper-Hewitt Museum
